name: Console
description: The Console object provides access to the browser's debugging console (e.g., the Web Console in Firefox). The specifics of how it works vary from browser to browser, but there is a de facto set of features that are typically provided.

members.name: Console.assert()
members.description: Log a message and stack trace to console if first argument is false.

parameters.name: assertion
parameters.description: Any boolean expression. If the assertion is false, the message is written to the console.

parameters.name: obj1 ... objN
parameters.description: A list of JavaScript objects to output. The string representations of each of these objects are appended together in the order listed and output.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.description: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

parameters.name: subst1 ... substN
parameters.description: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This parameter gives you additional control over the format of the output.

members.name: Console.clear()
members.description: Clear the console.

members.name: Console.count()
members.description: Log the number of times this line has been called with the given label.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A string. If this is supplied, count() outputs the number of times it has been called at this line and with that label.

members.name: Console.debug()
members.description: An alias for log() - starting with Chromium 58 this method is a no-op on Chromium browsers.

members.name: Console.dir()
members.description: Displays an interactive listing of the properties of a specified JavaScript object. This listing lets you use disclosure triangles to examine the contents of child objects.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: A JavaScript object whose properties should be output.

members.name: Console.dirxml()
members.description: Displays an XML/HTML Element representation of the specified object if possible or the JavaScript Object view if it is not.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: A JavaScript object whose properties should be output.

members.name: Console.error()
members.description: Outputs an error message. You may use string substitution and additional arguments with this method.

parameters.name: obj1 ... objN
parameters.description: A list of JavaScript objects to output. The string representations of each of these objects are appended together in the order listed and output.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.description: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

parameters.name: subst1 ... substN
parameters.description: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

members.name: Console.exception()
members.description: An alias for error()

members.name: Console.group()
members.description: Creates a new inline group, indenting all following output by another level. To move back out a level, call groupEnd().

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label for the group. Optional.   (Chrome 59 tested) Does not work with console.groupEnd()

members.name: Console.groupCollapsed()
members.description: Creates a new inline group, indenting all following output by another level; unlike group(), this starts with the inline group collapsed, requiring the use of a disclosure button to expand it. To move back out a level, call groupEnd().

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label for the group. Optional.

members.name: Console.groupEnd()
members.description: Exits the current inline group.

members.name: Console.info()
members.description: Informative logging information. You may use string substitution and additional arguments with this method.

parameters.name: obj1 ... objN
parameters.description: A list of JavaScript objects to output. The string representations of each of these objects are appended together in the order listed and output.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.description: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

parameters.name: subst1 ... substN
parameters.description: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

members.name: Console.log()
members.description: For general output of logging information. You may use string substitution and additional arguments with this method.

parameters.name: obj1 ... objN
parameters.description: A list of JavaScript objects to output. The string representations of each of these objects are appended together in the order listed and output.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.description: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

parameters.name: subst1 ... substN
parameters.description: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

members.name: Console.profile()
members.description: Starts the browser's build-in profiler (for example, the Firefox performance tool). You can specify an optional name for the profile.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: The name to give the profile. Optional.

members.name: Console.profileEnd()
members.description: Stops the profiler. You can see the resulting profile in the browser's performance tool (for example, the Firefox performance tool).

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: The name to give the profile. This parameter is optional.

members.name: Console.table()
members.description: Displays tabular data as a table.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to display. This must be either an array or an object.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: An array containing the names of columns to include in the output.

members.name: Console.time()
members.description: Starts a timer with a name specified as an input parameter. Up to 10,000 simultaneous timers can run on a given page.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The name to give the new timer. This will identify the timer; use the same name when calling console.timeEnd() to stop the timer and get the time output to the console.

members.name: Console.timeEnd()
members.description: Stops the specified timer and logs the elapsed time in seconds since its start.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The name of the timer to stop. Once stopped, the elapsed time is automatically displayed in the Web Console.

members.name: Console.timeStamp()
members.description: Adds a marker to the browser's Timeline or Waterfall tool.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label for the timestamp. Optional.

members.name: Console.trace()
members.description: Outputs a stack trace.

members.name: Console.warn()
members.description: Outputs a warning message. You may use string substitution and additional arguments with this method.

parameters.name: obj1 ... objN
parameters.description: A list of JavaScript objects to output. The string representations of each of these objects are appended together in the order listed and output.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.description: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

parameters.name: subst1 ... substN
parameters.description: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.
